description: This file declares the IEventHandler interface in C++, which contains virtual methods for handling various OCI container events, such as start, stop, failure, and state change events, all passing container name and data as parameters.

classes.name: IEventHandler
classes.description: An interface defining callback methods for OCI container events, meant to be implemented by classes that handle container lifecycle events.

methods.name: onOCIContainerStartedEvent
methods.description: Called when an OCI container has started; takes container name and event data.

methods.name: onOCIContainerStoppedEvent
methods.description: Called when an OCI container has stopped; takes container name and event data.

methods.name: onOCIContainerFailureEvent
methods.description: Called upon OCI container failure; takes container name and event data.

methods.name: onOCIContainerStateChangedEvent
methods.description: Called when OCI container state changes; takes container name and event data.
